title: Roman Emperor Septimius Severus dies at Eboracum (modern York, England) while preparing to lead a campaign against the Caledonians. He leaves the empire in the control of his two quarrelling sons.
text: • 211 – Roman Emperor Septimius Severus dies at Eboracum (modern York, England) while preparing to lead a campaign against the Caledonians. He leaves the empire in the control of his two quarrelling sons.

title: Battle of Dathin: Rashidun forces under Yazid ibn Abi Sufyan defeat an outnumbered Byzantine force near Gaza in Palestine.
text: • 634 – Battle of Dathin: Rashidun forces under Yazid ibn Abi Sufyan defeat an outnumbered Byzantine force near Gaza in Palestine.

title: The coronation of Zhao Kuangyin as Emperor Taizu of Song, initiating the Song dynasty period of China that would last more than three centuries.
text: • 960 – The coronation of Zhao Kuangyin as Emperor Taizu of Song, initiating the Song dynasty period of China that would last more than three centuries.

title: A strong earthquake struck the Ionian coast of Sicily, causing tens of thousands of injuries and deaths, especially in Catania.
text: • 1169 – A strong earthquake struck the Ionian coast of Sicily, causing tens of thousands of injuries and deaths, especially in Catania.

title: In the Thirteen Years' War, the Secret Council of the Prussian Confederation sends a formal act of disobedience to the Grand Master.
text: • 1454 – In the Thirteen Years' War, the Secret Council of the Prussian Confederation sends a formal act of disobedience to the Grand Master.

title: Bartolomeu Dias commands the first European expedition to reach South Africa and the Indian Ocean.
text: • 1488 – Bartolomeu Dias commands the first European expedition to reach South Africa and the Indian Ocean.

title: John Rogers is burned at the stake, becoming the first English Protestant martyr under Mary I of England.
text: • 1555 – John Rogers is burned at the stake, becoming the first English Protestant martyr under Mary I of England.

title: In Edo (now Tokyo), 46 of the Forty
text: • 1703 – In Edo (now Tokyo), 46 of the Forty-seven Ronin commit seppuku (ritual suicide) as recompense for avenging their master's death.

title: Macapá, Brazil is founded.
text: • 1758 – Macapá, Brazil is founded.

title: George Washington is unanimously elected as the first President of the United States by the U.S. Electoral College.
text: • 1789 – George Washington is unanimously elected as the first President of the United States by the U.S. Electoral College.

title: The French legislature abolishes slavery throughout all territories of the French First Republic. It will be reestablished in the French West Indies in 1802.
text: • 1794 – The French legislature abolishes slavery throughout all territories of the French First Republic. It will be reestablished in the French West Indies in 1802.

title: The Riobamba earthquake strikes Ecuador, causing up to 40,000 casualties.
text: • 1797 – The Riobamba earthquake strikes Ecuador, causing up to 40,000 casualties.

title: John Marshall is sworn in as Chief Justice of the United States.
text: • 1801 – John Marshall is sworn in as Chief Justice of the United States.

title: The Royal Navy seizes Guadeloupe.
text: • 1810 – The Royal Navy seizes Guadeloupe.

title: The Chilean Navy under the command of Lord Cochrane completes the 2
text: • 1820 – The Chilean Navy under the command of Lord Cochrane completes the 2-day long Capture of Valdivia with just 300 men and 2 ships.

title: The Ohio Legislature authorizes the construction of the Ohio and Erie Canal and the Miami and Erie Canal.
text: • 1825 – The Ohio Legislature authorizes the construction of the Ohio and Erie Canal and the Miami and Erie Canal.

title: The first Mormon pioneers make their exodus from Nauvoo, Illinois, westward towards Salt Lake Valley.
text: • 1846 – The first Mormon pioneers make their exodus from Nauvoo, Illinois, westward towards Salt Lake Valley.

title: The Codex Sinaiticus is discovered in Egypt.
text: • 1859 – The Codex Sinaiticus is discovered in Egypt.

title: American Civil War: In Montgomery, Alabama, delegates from six break
text: • 1861 – American Civil War: In Montgomery, Alabama, delegates from six break-away U.S. states meet and form the Confederate States of America.

title: The Philippine
text: • 1899 – The Philippine–American War begins with the Battle of Manila.

title: Second Sino
text: • 1932 – Second Sino-Japanese War: Harbin, Manchuria, falls to Japan.

title: The United Service Organization (USO) is created to entertain American troops.
text: • 1941 – The United Service Organization (USO) is created to entertain American troops.

title: World War II: Santo Tomas Internment Camp is liberated from Japanese authority.
text: • 1945 – World War II: Santo Tomas Internment Camp is liberated from Japanese authority.

title: World War II: The Yalta Conference between the "Big Three" (Churchill, Roosevelt, and Stalin) opens at the Livadia Palace in the Crimea.
text: • 1945 – World War II: The Yalta Conference between the "Big Three" (Churchill, Roosevelt, and Stalin) opens at the Livadia Palace in the Crimea.

title: World War II: The British Indian Army and Imperial Japanese Army begin a series of battles known as the Battle of Pokoku and Irrawaddy River operations.
text: • 1945 – World War II: The British Indian Army and Imperial Japanese Army begin a series of battles known as the Battle of Pokoku and Irrawaddy River operations.

title: Ceylon (later renamed Sri Lanka) becomes independent within the British Commonwealth.
text: • 1948 – Ceylon (later renamed Sri Lanka) becomes independent within the British Commonwealth.

title: The Angolan War of Independence and the greater Portuguese Colonial War begin.
text: • 1961 – The Angolan War of Independence and the greater Portuguese Colonial War begin.

title: All Nippon Airways Flight 60 plunges into Tokyo Bay, killing 133.
text: • 1966 – All Nippon Airways Flight 60 plunges into Tokyo Bay, killing 133.

title: Lunar Orbiter program: Lunar Orbiter 3 lifts off from Cape Canaveral's Launch Complex 13 on its mission to identify possible landing sites for the Surveyor and Apollo spacecraft.
text: • 1967 – Lunar Orbiter program: Lunar Orbiter 3 lifts off from Cape Canaveral's Launch Complex 13 on its mission to identify possible landing sites for the Surveyor and Apollo spacecraft.

title: Yasser Arafat takes over as chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization.
text: • 1969 – Yasser Arafat takes over as chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: The Symbionese Liberation Army kidnaps Patty Hearst in Berkeley, California.
text: • 1974 – The Symbionese Liberation Army kidnaps Patty Hearst in Berkeley, California.

title: M62 coach bombing: The Provisional Irish Republican Army (IRA) explodes a bomb on a bus carrying off
text: • 1974 – M62 coach bombing: The Provisional Irish Republican Army (IRA) explodes a bomb on a bus carrying off-duty British Armed Forces personnel in Yorkshire, England. Nine soldiers and three civilians are killed.

title: Haicheng earthquake (magnitude 7.3 on the Richter scale) occurs in Haicheng, Liaoning, China.
text: • 1975 – Haicheng earthquake (magnitude 7.3 on the Richter scale) occurs in Haicheng, Liaoning, China.

title: In Guatemala and Honduras an earthquake kills more than 22,000.
text: • 1976 – In Guatemala and Honduras an earthquake kills more than 22,000.

title: A Chicago Transit Authority elevated train rear
text: • 1977 – A Chicago Transit Authority elevated train rear-ends another and derails, killing 11 and injuring 180, the worst accident in the agency's history.

title: A coup d'état is led by Hugo Chávez against Venezuelan President Carlos Andrés Pérez.
text: • 1992 – A coup d'état is led by Hugo Chávez against Venezuelan President Carlos Andrés Pérez.

title: En route to Lebanon, two Israeli Sikorsky CH
text: • 1997 – En route to Lebanon, two Israeli Sikorsky CH-53 troop-transport helicopters collide in mid-air over northern Galilee, Israel killing 73.

title: The 5.9 Mw Afghanistan earthquake shakes the Takhar Province with a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong). With 2,323 killed, and 818 injured, damage is considered extreme.
text: • 1998 – The 5.9 Mw Afghanistan earthquake shakes the Takhar Province with a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong). With 2,323 killed, and 818 injured, damage is considered extreme.

title: Unarmed West African immigrant Amadou Diallo is shot 41 times by four plainclothes New York City police officers on an unrelated stake
text: • 1999 – Unarmed West African immigrant Amadou Diallo is shot 41 times by four plainclothes New York City police officers on an unrelated stake-out, inflaming race relations in the city.

title: The Federal Republic of Yugoslavia is officially renamed Serbia and Montenegro and adopts a new constitution.
text: • 2003 – The Federal Republic of Yugoslavia is officially renamed Serbia and Montenegro and adopts a new constitution.

title: Facebook, a mainstream online social networking site, is founded by Mark Zuckerberg.
text: • 2004 – Facebook, a mainstream online social networking site, is founded by Mark Zuckerberg.

title: TransAsia Airways Flight 235 with 58 people on board, en route from the Taiwanese capital Taipei to Kinmen, crashes into the Keelung River just after take
text: • 2015 – TransAsia Airways Flight 235 with 58 people on board, en route from the Taiwanese capital Taipei to Kinmen, crashes into the Keelung River just after take-off, killing 43 people.
